answers.answer: Oh yeah they can.  I have diabetes and have lived with it for 17 years.  I get really irritable and the reasoning I have is because my body is starving for energy.  It's primal instinct to protect yourself and do whatever is necessary to defend yourself.  When the body senses the lack of energy it is also starving the brain.  If you can't make rationale decisions because you have no energy to spare, you revert.It's not a gurantee that it will happen, but I personally can say that it does happen.The best thing to do is help her find sugar and wait until she comes back around.

question: My sister is 46 and has had type 1 diabetes since she was 6.  She has had a kidney transplant as well as breast and esophgial cancer (radiation and chemo).   Recently during an insulin reaction she displayed childlike behavior much like a toddler pitching a temper tantrum.  Do adults with juvenile or type 1 diabetes typically regress in behavior?  Her behavior has never been this eratic during a reaction.
title: behavior issues during insulin reactions
